markdown: ###### [Mask of the Grotto Deep](/maskOfTheGrottoDeep/); [Kraken's Eye](/krakensEye/) | rewardname2 = Leave the machine operating | reward2 = Moderate Negative reputation with the [RDC](/royalDeadfireCompany/) (negated with Diplomacy 8);{{cp2|600}};[Savage Cunning](/statusEffectsDeadfirePermanentEffects/) (+1 [Perception](/perception/), +2 [Survival](/survival/)) | rewardname3 = | reward3 = | rewardname4 = | reward4 = | rewardname5 = | reward5 = | rewardname6 = | reward6 = | prev = A Matter of Import | next = Clearing Out Crookspur | conc = | internalname = FCT_QST_RDC03_Overgrown_Coral | guid = 11dd2414-37c0-4ef2-82ac-ed48b550f3ef }} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [faction quest](/pillarsOfEternityIiDeadfireQuestsFactionQuests/) in {{poe2}}. ## Synopsis Fleet Master Okaya has asked the Watcher to discover the source of a magical disturbance causing the coral in [Sayuka](/sayuka/)'s port to grow out of control. ## Walkthrough * This quest will begin on completion of [A Matter of Import](/aMatterOfImport/), after talking to [Fleet Master Okaya](/fleetMasterOkaya/). She will ask you to pay a visit to the recently-arrived [Iverra](/iverra/) at the [workshop](/workshopSayuka/) on [Sayuka](/sayuka/) to find out what they've learned. * Upon entering the workshop, Iverra is in conversation with one of the [Coralmason](/coralmason/). They've determined that the wild coral growths are being caused by a source of magical disturbance that lies somewhere in the deep sea to the southeast of the island, the location of [Cignath Mór](/cignathMor/), an old drowned [Engwithan](/engwithans/) ruin. Iverra hands you her masterpiece, a set of [Diving Equipment](/divingEquipment/). * Leave the workshop, and you'll immediately be thrown into a yet another problem [Sayuka](/sayuka/) is facing: Bog Druids. This starts [Hunting Season](/huntingSeason/), though it is unrelated to this quest. * Leave Sayuka and travel just southeast of the island to a new icon on the world map. Interact with it to dive down to the [Engwithan](/engwithans/) ruin. ###### Cignath Mór * As you swim down to approach the ruins, you come to a magical barrier, which is holding back the water from consuming the area entirely. and creating a large pocket of breathable air surrounding the ruins. * See the main article, [Cignath Mór](/cignathMor/), for a walkthrough on this area. Once you get to the lower level (and after slaughtering a bunch of seafolk) you will find the adra machine, the cause of the coral growths. It is under the protection of [Galawain](/galawain/), who explains that it is feeding the creatures in the area, strengthening them so that they become "..strong and ruthless - and in so doing, worthy of [his] regard." You can do one of two things: ** Disable the [Engwithan](/engwithans/) machine that makes the corals grow. This will anger [Galawain](/galawain/), who confronts you with a [Kraken](/kraken/) to fight on your way out of the structure. You can loot the unique helm [Mask of the Grotto Deep](/maskOfTheGrottoDeep/) and a [Kraken's Eye](/krakensEye/) off him. This result is preferred by the Fleet Master. ** Leave the machine operating and disable three pylons to flood the ruins. If you attempt to disable the machine first, [Galawain](/galawain/) promises you a boon for disabling the pylons instead. Once the ruins are flooded, you dive up to your ship; the watcher must pass a [Mechanics](/mechanics/) 9 or [Athletics](/athletics/) 10 check to avoid injury. If [Galawain](/galawain/) promised a boon, the watcher gains [Savage Cunning](/statusEffectsDeadfirePermenentEffects/) (+1 [Perception](/perception/), +2 [Survival](/survival/)). upon returning to the surface. The Fleet Master is unhappy with this result, which leads to a moderate reputation loss with the [Royal Deadfire Company](/royalDeadfireCompany/). The reputation loss can be recouped by passing a diplomacy check. ## Notes * Disabling the [Engwithan](/engwithans/) machine will gain approval from [Pallegina](/palleginaMesRei/) and disapproval from [Xoti](/xoti/). ## Gallery ###### Diving down to Cignath Mór RE si open water.png 15 si diving helmet.png 15 si diving.png 15 si ruins approach.png ## Journal {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" style="word-break:break-all" | Quests/XX_RDC_Faction_Questline/FCT_QST_RDC03_Overgrown_Coral.quest |- ! width="40px" | {{tooltip|ID|Objectives: 0, Descriptions: 10000, Addenda: 20000, End states: 30000, Alternate descriptions: 40000}} ! colspan="2" | Objectives |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''0''' | colspan="2" | '''Overgrowth''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10000 | Fleet Master Okaya has asked me to discover the source of a magical disturbance causing the coral in Sayuka's port to grow out of control. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''1''' | colspan="2" | '''Speak to Iverra.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10001 | Fleet Master Okaya told me to talk to Iverra, a Vailian scientist who might be able to help me get to the source of Sayuka's coral problem. I can find her in the Royal Deadfire Company's workshop in Sayuka. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''5''' | colspan="2" | '''Travel to the underwater ruins of Cignath Mór.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10005 | Iverra believes the source of the coral's overgrowth is an Engwithan ruin, Cignath Mór. She gave me a diving helm so I might explore the ruin, which lies deep beneath the sea off the southern coast of Sayuka. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''6''' | colspan="2" | '''Travel to the underwater ruins of Cignath Mór.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10006 | Head Engineer Hetu believes the source of the coral's overgrowth is an Engwithan ruin, Cignath Mór. He gave me a diving helm so I might explore the ruin, which lies deep beneath the sea off the southern coast of Sayuka. |- | rowspan="4" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''7''' | colspan="2" | '''Find the source of the magical growth.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10007 | I've arrived at the ruins of Cignath Mór and discovered they're full of breathable air. I still need to find whatever is causing the coral to grow out of control and put an end to it. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20003 | I found a small Engwithan machine, but I can't figure out what it does. Maybe something else in the ruins will shed some light on it. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20007 | I found a large Engwithan machine humming with energy, but I've decided against touching anything for now. |- | rowspan="6" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''8''' | colspan="2" | '''Deal with the machine.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10008 | I found the machine at the source of the coral's growth, but when I attempted to shut it down, Galawain intervened. He asked that I leave the machine alone and instead deactivate the pylons that generate the shield protecting Cignath Mór from the sea. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20000 | I agreed to help Galawain, and he told me to deactivate three pylons somewhere in the ruin. Doing so should lower the barrier keeping the sea at bay. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20001 | I disabled one of the pylons, which appears to have slightly weakened the protective barrier . Two remain. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20002 | I disabled a second pylon, and the barrier has weakened considerably. One pylon remains. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20004 | I disabled the machine responsible for the out of control coral growth. Galawain is not pleased. |- | rowspan="3" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''9''' | colspan="2" | '''Return to Fleet Master Okaya.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10009 | Despite Galawain's request, I disabled the machine responsible for the coral's overgrowth. I should return to Fleet Master Okaya and confirm the coral has returned to a manageable size. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20006 | As revenge for my defiance, Galawain sent a kraken to stop me from leaving the ruins, but I prevailed. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''10''' | colspan="2" | '''Return to Fleet Master Okaya.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10010 | As Galawain requested, I destroyed the pylons inside Cignath Mór. Without the shield to protect it, the ruin was swallowed by the sea. I should return to Fleet Master Okaya and give her the bad news. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''12''' | colspan="2" | '''Return to Fleet Master Okaya.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10012 | I shut down the pylons inside Cignath Mór, and the ruins were swallowed by the sea. I should return to Fleet Master Okaya and find out if my efforts solved her coral problem. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''18''' | colspan="2" | '''Speak to Head Engineer Hetu.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10018 | Fleet Master Okaya told me to talk to Hetu, the head engineer in Sayuka. He might be able to help me get to the source of the coral problem. I can find him in the Royal Deadfire Company's workshop in Sayuka with the rest of the engineers. |- ! colspan="3" | Unused strings |- | rowspan="1" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''-''' | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 40001 | |- ! colspan="3" | End states |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30000 | Fleet Master Okaya was well pleased by how I resolved the coral situation. She's ordered that Sayuka's port be reopened without delay. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30001 | Fleet Master Okaya was incensed to learn the coral situation will remain unresolved, and she dismissed me with a token payment for my efforts. However, the blessing Galawain bestowed on me for doing his bidding will no doubt prove beneficial. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30002 | Fleet Master Okaya was incensed to learn the coral situation remains unresolved, and she dismissed me with a token payment for my efforts. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{cross}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30003 | The Royal Deadfire Company have declared themselves against me. I suspect they'll no longer be receptive to my help with their coral problem. |}

She will ask you to pay a visit to the recently-arrived [[Iverra]] at the [[Workshop (Sayuka)|workshop]] on [[Sayuka]] to find out what they've learned. * Upon entering the workshop, Iverra is in conversation with one of the [[Coralmason]]. They've determined that the wild coral growths are being caused by a source of magical disturbance that lies somewhere in the deep sea to the southeast of the island, the location of [[Cignath Mór]], an old drowned [[Engwithans|Engwithan]] ruin. Iverra hands you her masterpiece, a set of [[Diving Equipment]]. * Leave the workshop, and you'll immediately be thrown into a yet another problem [[Sayuka]] is facing: Bog Druids. This starts [[Hunting Season]], though it is unrelated to this quest. * Leave Sayuka and travel just southeast of the island to a new icon on the world map. Interact with it to dive down to the [[Engwithans|Engwithan]] ruin. ;Cignath Mór * As you swim down to approach the ruins, you come to a magical barrier, which is holding back the water from consuming the area entirely. and creating a large pocket of breathable air surrounding the ruins. * See the main article, [[Cignath Mór]], for a walkthrough on this area. Once you get to the lower level (and after slaughtering a bunch of seafolk) you will find the adra machine, the cause of the coral growths. It is under the protection of [[Galawain]], who explains that it is feeding the creatures in the area, strengthening them so that they become "..strong and ruthless - and in so doing, worthy of [his] regard." You can do one of two things: ** Disable the [[Engwithans|Engwithan]] machine that makes the corals grow. This will anger [[Galawain]], who confronts you with a [[Kraken]] to fight on your way out of the structure. You can loot the unique helm [[Mask of the Grotto Deep]] and a [[Kraken's Eye]] off him. This result is preferred by the Fleet Master. ** Leave the machine operating and disable three pylons to flood the ruins. If you attempt to disable the machine first, [[Galawain]] promises you a boon for disabling the pylons instead. Once the ruins are flooded, you dive up to your ship; the watcher must pass a [[Mechanics]] 9 or [[Athletics]] 10 check to avoid injury. If [[Galawain]] promised a boon, the watcher gains [[Status effects (Deadfire)#Permenent effects|Savage Cunning]] (+1 [[Perception]], +2 [[Survival]]). upon returning to the surface. The Fleet Master is unhappy with this result, which leads to a moderate reputation loss with the [[Royal Deadfire Company]]. The reputation loss can be recouped by passing a diplomacy check. == Notes == * Disabling the [[Engwithans|Engwithan]] machine will gain approval from [[Pallegina mes Rèi|Pallegina]] and disapproval from [[Xoti]]. ==Gallery== ;Diving down to Cignath Mór RE si open water.png 15 si diving helmet.png 15 si diving.png 15 si ruins approach.png ==Journal== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" style="word-break:break-all" | Quests/XX_RDC_Faction_Questline/FCT_QST_RDC03_Overgrown_Coral.quest |- ! width="40px" | {{tooltip|ID|Objectives: 0, Descriptions: 10000, Addenda: 20000, End states: 30000, Alternate descriptions: 40000}} ! colspan="2" | Objectives |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''0''' | colspan="2" | '''Overgrowth''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10000 | Fleet Master Okaya has asked me to discover the source of a magical disturbance causing the coral in Sayuka's port to grow out of control. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''1''' | colspan="2" | '''Speak to Iverra.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10001 | Fleet Master Okaya told me to talk to Iverra, a Vailian scientist who might be able to help me get to the source of Sayuka's coral problem. title: Overgrowth
